sentences.english: "city god"), a deity in Chinese Daoist mythology who is responsible for the affairs of the city.
sentences.chinese: 城隍是中国道教神话中守护城池的神明。

sentences.english: After visiting Chenghuangmiao, we went to Pudong District to visit Dongfang Pearl Towel.
sentences.chinese: 逛完城隍庙后，我们乘车去浦东参观东方明珠。

sentences.english: Another example is the City God of Taipei whose birthday is celebrated every year.
sentences.chinese: 另外台北人每年都会庆祝城隍爷的生日。

sentences.english: The city god was one of the most influential gods to the official and plebs since the Ming Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 城隍神是明代以来官方和民间最有影响力的神祗之一。

sentences.english: He is remembered now also as an educator as well as a city god of Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他还被人们视为教育家，更被尊为北京城城隍。

sentences.english: Location of the general city-god temples in Ming and Qing Dynasties is especially complex.
sentences.chinese: 明清时期的都城隍庙在建置中呈现出复杂局面。

sentences.english: Railroad Town god's temple in Shanghai and Yiyuan Shopping is such a place.
sentences.chinese: 上海老城厢内的城隍庙和豫园，便是这样的一个地方。

sentences.english: Because of historical reasons Temple has long been occupied by department stores.
sentences.chinese: 但因历史原因城隍庙长期以来被百货商店占用。

sentences.english: You haven't told me whether it is a neat temple fair or not.
sentences.chinese: 你刚才还没告诉我呢，城隍庙会好玩吗？

sentences.english: Near the elaborate Chenghuang, or City God, Temple in Shanghai are the famous Yu Yuan Bazaar and Gardens.
sentences.chinese: 在上海城隍庙附近，就是著名的豫园集市和园林。

sentences.english: Excuse me, could you tell me the way to the City God Temple?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，能告诉我去城隍庙的怎么走吗？

sentences.english: Chapter three, art achievements of Qing anecdotal novels.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分，清代笔记小说中城隍故事的艺术成就。

sentences.english: Shanghai's City God Temple is just a decoration, a stunt.
sentences.chinese: 上海的城隍庙不过是一个摆设，一个噱头。

definition: Tudi Gong, the God of the earth
the three gods in charge of heaven, earth and water (Daoism)
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple
magistrate (during Tang and Song dynasties)/mythological underworld judge
to worship/to pay respects to (a deity, ancestor etc)/(of a shrine or temple) to be dedicated to (a deity, ancestor etc)
to offer sacrifices to the gods
stars of the Big Dipper that constitute the rectangular body of the dipper/Kuixing, Daoist God of fate
